Key Match Events: Bronny James had a chase-down block of his own in his Los Angeles Lakers debut Friday with his father, LeBron James, sitting on the bench to witness it.
The Lakers' No. 55 pick did not give up on the play, sprinting to catch up to the 6-foot-5 Alexander-Walker and, despite being 6-2, easily leaping high enough to swat the attempt away from behind.
Pre-Game Insights: Lakers coach JJ Redick said James earned the rotation minutes after a strong showing in the first week of training camp.
Redick said he expects James to suit up Sunday when the Lakers play the Phoenix Suns, which could be the first time the father and son are in uniform together.
Post-Match Reflections: Redick focused on James' defensive impact that was already apparent.
He's got a great soul and just a great energy about him. I like being around him. I'm rooting for him. He's a good player that we're happy to have in our program.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bronny James finished with two points on 1-for-6 shooting in the Lakers' 124-107 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves to open their six-game exhibition slate.
Others: LeBron James did not play Friday, with Redick holding out the 22-year veteran to rest after he competed for USA Basketball in the Paris Olympics.
